title: A/B Testing (Optimizely)
desc: An experimentation platform that allows marketing teams to test and personalize webpages for constant iteration and optimization based on data-driven hypotheses.

title: Audience Quality
desc: Provides visibility into audience performance by response across four dimensions: job role, industry, individual newness, and company client status.

title: Brand Health
desc: Helps business leaders understand how clients and prospects perceive IBM and competitors, and what drives these perceptions, so that we can plan more effective brand engagement experiences.

title: Content Analytics
desc: Provides Content and Campaign Managers with a view of web content and video engagement by traffic source, device type, and campaign.

title: Discovery & Engagement
desc: Understand the marketing activities which resulted in clients and prospects discovering and engaging with IBM. Contains metrics from Cost and Impressions through to Responses and HQ Responses, allowing users to dive deeper into metrics in the earlier stages of a campaign.

title: Email
desc: Understand effectiveness of email marketing activities and identify what could be improved. Provides a summary level view where users can drill down into detailed dimensions, as well as Email Deliverability and Email Effectiveness tabs.

title: Digital Offering Funnel
desc: View end-to-end funnel metrics for Digital Offerings from visits to wins and NPS.

title: E2E Funnel
desc: A scorecard view with key campaign KPIs used to identify areas to optimize performance and efficiency.

title: Event Detail
desc: Provides visibility to number of events, registrations, and attendees. Displays Actual, YTY and % Achievement of Projection events executed in a table format which is custimizable by using filters and format table options.

title: Event End to End
desc: Provides visibility to the performance of a group of events in creating (Marketing Source) and progressing pipeline (Total Win Influence). Displays YTD and YTY actuals for events executed.

title: Event Revenue
desc: Provides visibility to the performance of a group of events in creating (Marketing Source) and progressing pipeline (Total Win Influence). Displays Actual, YTD and Life of Revenue for events executed.

title: Event ROI
desc: Understand return on investment (ROI) from events. Displays Actuals and E:R for events executed.

title: Forecast Quarter Contribution
desc: Measures marketing contribution to current quarter (CQ), next quarter (NQ), or next quarter plus one (NQ+1) pipeline. Displays Actual, YTY, and % Contribution of opportunity pipeline for the forecast quarter from sales and marketing.

title: Heatmaps & Visitor Tracking (Hotjar)
desc: A platform that allows Digital Strategists to track user journeys through heatmaps of our website and video replays of individual user journeys on a page (URL).

title: IBM Digital Analytics
desc: (formerly Coremetrics) A platform for Analytics Specialists to build and share custom reports for deep dive web analytics beyond standardized, higher level views in Pearl.

title: Keywords (BrightEdge)
desc: Provides 360 degree view of Organic Search performance from ranking to traffic and conversions. Customize dashboards to view your performance against competitors, conduct keyword research, run a site crawl for technical issues or look at the backlinks profile of your website.

title: Live Chat Metrics
desc: Provides visibility to the drivers and performance of live chat across IBM pages, geographies, and business units. Enables teams to identify opportunities for improving the chat rate by evaluating chat engagement, placement, or availability.

title: Lotame
desc: A DMP that provides a way to manage our online cookie data along with third party data, for targeting and analysis.

title: Marketing Progress
desc: Measures pipeline progression (sales stage, revenue amount, forecast quarter) which resulted from a client interacting with marketing activities during the life of an opportunity. Displays Year-to-date, Week-to-week, and Year-to-year Marketing Progress actuals.

title: Source Quarterly Targets
desc: Measure achievement of Marketing Source quarter-end results to marketing targets by quarter for RLM MCR, BP MCR and Assist to Create.

title: Marketing Source
desc: Measures pipeline creation which resulted from a client interacting with marketing activities prior to opportunity creation. Displays Year-to-date, Week-to-week, and Year-to-year Marketing Source actuals.

title: Source Targets
desc: Measures achievement of Marketing Source actual results to marketing targets and weekly track indicator for RLM MCR, BP MCR, and Assist to Create

title: Marketing Top Sheet
desc: Provides Chief Marketing Officers (CMO) and marketing leaders with a view of marketing efficiency across Plans, Programs, or Projects.

title: Marketing Win Influence
desc: Measures won business outcome for Marketing Source of Marketing Progress opportunities. Displays Year-to-date, Week-to-week, Year-to-year, and Life of Marketing Win Influence actuals.

title: Paid Media
desc: Provides Chief Marketing Officers (CMO), Campaign Managers, and Paid Media and Digital Strategists a view of Paid Media efficiency and effectiveness across Plans, Projects and Geos.

title: Net Promoter Score (Medallia)
desc: Delivers real-time customer feedback from moments of truth across the client journey through NPS and client verbatims.

title: Page Insights
desc: Provides a page (URL) level optimization view that includes traffic and engagement metrics, conversion events, and registry information. Includes campaign-driven traffic (VCPI / Plan Framework) and organic traffic.

title: Response Management
desc: Provides marketers a view of how responses are being managed by marketing automation (EMM).

title: RLM Create Funnel
desc: Provides visibility to campaign responses, the resulting workload sent to RLM resources, and the final outcome of the workload, including opportunities created (RLM MCR). Displays Actual and YTY actuals of responses, RLM workload, and Marketing Source RLM MCR.

title: RLM Workload Detail
desc: Provides visibility to status of workload sent to RLM resources working in SalesConnect or SalesForce. Displays Actual, WTW and YTY actuals for RLM Workload.

title: SaaS Acceleration Funnel
desc: Provides SaaS product marketing performance against weekly volume and Annual Contract Value (ACV$) targets.

title: Web Metrics
desc: Understand and review aggregate web visits and engagement at Total Marketing, Business Unit, and GBT levels.

title: Web Page KPIs
desc: Provides visibility to performance at the page (URL) level for web visits and engagement related metrics segmented at Total Marketing, Business Units, and GBT Level.

title: Webcast E2E Detail
desc: Provides visibility to the performance of a group of webcasts in creating (Marketing Source) and progressing pipeline (Total Win Influence). Displays YTD and YTY actuals for events executed.

title: Win Influence Quarterly Targets
desc: Measures achievement of Marketing Win Influence to quarterly track indicator of target at the Geo / Market, Brand and Revenue Type.

title: Win Influence Targets
desc: Measures achievement of Marketing Win Influence to weekly track indicator of target at the Geo / Market, Brand and Revenue Type.

title: YTD Source Contribution
desc: Measure marketing contribution to total business pipeline creation. Displays Year-to-date, Year-to-year, and % Contribution of opportunities created in the current year from sales and marketing.

title: YTD Win Influence Contribution
desc: Measure marketing contribution to total business pipeline wins. Displays Year-to-date, Year-to-year, and % Contribution of opportunities won in the current year from sales and marketing.
synonyms: year to date win influence contribution

title: % Chats Initiated
desc: Percentage of conversion events where chat was triggered for a page or group of pages. Calculated: Chat conversion events / Total conversion events

title: % Mobile Video Starts
desc: The percentage of video starts that are mobile video starts. Calculated: Mobile Video Starts / Total Video Starts

title: % Mobile Visits
desc: A visit (session) is an interaction, by an individual, with an IBM Marketing website. A visit can contain multiple page views. A visit times out after 30 minutes of inactivity.  IBM employees, IBM agencies, and bots are excluded from the metric.

title: % of High Quality Responses Sent to XXR
desc: Percentage of high quality responses (Strong or Medium score) that are sent to XXR for follow-up.

title: % of Responses Acted On by Flowchart
desc: Percentage of responses that IBM followed up on via Email or XXR.

title: % of Visits with Chat Installed
desc: Chat Installed Visits/Total Marketing Visits

title: % Owned/Earned Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of total owned/earned video starts that result in owned/earned video completes (video is watched 75% or more). Calculated: Owned – Earned Video Completes / Owned-Earned Video Starts

title: % Owned/Earned Engagement Rate
desc: The percentage of total owned/earned visits that are considered engaged (relevant second click). Calculated: Owned-Earned Engaged Visits/ Total Owned-Earned Visits

title: % Owned/Earned Video Starts
desc: The percentage of video starts that are Owned/Earned video starts. Calculated: Owned-Earned Video Starts / Total Video Starts

title: % Owned/Earned Visit
desc: The percentage of visits that are Owned/Earned video visits. Calculated: Owned/Earned Visits / Total Visits

title: % Paid Starts
desc: The percentage of video starts that are paid video starts. Calculated: Paid Video Starts / Total Video Starts

title: % Paid Visits
desc: The percentage of visits that are paid visit. Calculated: Paid Visits / Total Visits

title: % Scheduled
desc: Percentage of conversion events where the Scheduler conversion was triggered for a page or group of pages. Calculated: Scheduler conversion events / Total conversion events

title: % Trials
desc: Percentage of conversion events where the Trial conversion was triggered for a page or group of pages. Calculated: Trial conversion events / Total conversion events

title: % Valid Registrations
desc: Percentage of total registrations that are considered ‘valid’ based on the removal of any records with data quality flags and IBMers. Calculated: (Registrations – IBMers and Data Quality issues) / Registrations

title: <20 Seconds Wait Time
desc: Number of answered chats with a response time of less than 20 seconds.

title: Acquisition Name
desc: Identifies the name of a company or product acquisition using a software sales mapping of product codes.

title: Action Taken by Flowchart
desc: Count of addressable responses where a flowchart has taken action, e.g. Sent Email Only, Sent XXR Only, Sent Both Email and to XXR and No action)

title: Actionable %
desc: Calculated: The percentage of closed RLM Workload that has been attempted and resulted in an interaction with the contact by the XXR. Closed Actionable RLM Workload (Status Detail of Contact Created, Marketing Nurture, or Not Interested) divided by Closed RLM Workload.

title: Actionable Leads
desc: Count of RLM Workload closed by XXR with Lead Status Detail of Contact Created, Marketing Nurture or Not Interested.

title: Asset
desc: Identifies a specific piece of marketing content.  Asset Version Codes are defined in UMO and captured during registration (MRS/URX forms).

title: Asset Page URL
desc: The published, external facing URL of the Asset. This URL is also known as the Delivery URL.

title: Asset Type
desc: Identifies the format or content of the asset

title: Asset Type Group
desc: Categorizes offer types based upon similar attributes, such as customer stories.

title: Availability Rate
desc: Chat Available Visits/ (Chat Available Visits + Chat Not Available Visits). Expected availability is 100% during business hours (8AM-6PM local time).

title: Available + Not Available
desc: Visits to pages in which the “chat available” or “chat not available” coremetrics tag fired. Softlayer pages are excluded. Will not match total visit pages in other Pearl views because availability flags are not always captured (i.e. if the visitor leaves before tag can fire).

title: Available Visits
desc: Visits to pages in which the “chat available” coremetrics tag fired. Will fire if an IBM rep is logged in and ready to receive a chat. Expected availability is 100% during business hours (8AM-6PM local time). Softlayer pages are excluded.

title: Average Time Watched
desc: The average time individuals watched a video, measured in seconds.

title: Avg Influence Win
desc: Calculated: Total Influence Win Revenue / Count of Influence Wins

title: Avg Source VL
desc: Calculated: Source Validated Lead Revenue / Count of Source Validated Leads

title: Avg Source Win
desc: Calculated: Total Source Win Revenue / Count of Source Wins

title: Bounce Rate
desc: Percentage of emails sent that could not be delivered due to either a Hard Bounce or Soft Bounce.

title: Business Partner
desc: An IBM business partner (BP).  Marketing created revenue from BP created opportunities (BP MCR) is reported only when a valid marketing code is associated with the opportunity.

title: Business Unit Outcome
desc: Business unit assigned by the IBM DDR for the chat. Does not align exactly with GBT 10.

title: Buyer Stage
desc: The Marketer Workspace Campaign Journey Stage.

title: Buying Cycle
desc: Stage in the purchase lifecycle of an asset.  Clients move toward “Buy” as they gather information and knowledge.

title: Campaign Status
desc: The current status of a marketing campaign, as defined in Marketer Workspace.

title: Campaign Visits
desc: Count of web visits driven by campaign activity (as measured by the presence of VCPI campaign tags). Visits are deduplicated at a session level.

title: Cell
desc: A cell name (and code) defines the campaign-specific grouping of an audience that will receive a similar treatment. In email marketing, a cell name (and code) can be leveraged by the following creative treatements: an entire mailing, personalization variation of mailings, and/or A/B testing of mailings.

title: Chat
desc: Count of the number of times the IBM Digital Analytics conversion events for Live Chat were triggered.

title: Chat Installed Ever
desc: Visits to pages in which the “chat installed” coremetrics tag fired at least once ever

title: Chat Installed Visits
desc: Visits to marketing pages in which the “Chat Installed” coremetrics tag fired

title: Chat Not Installed Visits
desc: Visits to pages in which the “chat installed” coremetrics tag did not fire. Represents visits to pages where chat is not installed.

title: Chat Result
desc: Result of a survey filled out by IBM reps post-chat. This helps us classify chats as “High Quality” or “Sales”

title: Chats
desc: A chat in which the user was connected to an agent, and the user sent at least 1 message (i.e. interactive chat). The count excludes ghost chats (e.g. IBM initiated a chat but the user did not respond). Softlayer limits chat to Sales and Marketing based on skills queues.

title: Click
desc: When a user clicks on a call to action / linked content. This may be clicking a media impression, within an email, or within the IBM.com site. A click may or may not result in a subsequent visit as there is some expected dropoff. In the case of touch-screen devices, the user “clicks” by touching the active area with their finger or a stylus.

title: Click Through Rate
desc: The percentage of total paid media impressions (paid search, paid social, and display) that were clicked by a potential visitor. Calculated: Clicks / Impression

title: Click to Open Rate
desc: The percentage of opened emails that resulted in a user clicking on content. Calculated: Unique Email Clicks / Unique Email Opens

title: Click to Visit Rate
desc: The percentage of paid media (display, paid social, paid search) clicks that resulted in a visit. Calculated: Campaign visits (excludes email and owned social) / clicks. There is expected dropoff from clicks to visits.

title: Client Geography
desc: The location of where the client or prospect or web visitor is located. This dimension is available in the data for visits through wins, but not at earlier stages of the funnel.

title: Client Tier
desc: Market segmentation of MidMarket and Enterprise that enables end-to-end sales strategy planning and execution.

title: Client Type
desc: A grouping of customers based on their size and IBM relationship.  A dimension against which reporting results are classified which distinguishes the results by the customer set of the account to which the result is associated (landing view).

title: Close Category
desc: Response and lead management (RLM Workload) defined groups of Lead Status Detail.

title: Close Year/Quarter
desc: Quarter the opportunity is expected to close, which is based on the Forecast (HW/SW) or Decision Date (Services). Forecast / Decision date is a date recorded on the opportunity for each revenue (component) record that identifies when the customer can expect to be billed or sign a contract for this component, assuming IBM wins the opportunity.

title: Closed %
desc: Calculated: Percent of the total records sent to XXR which have been completed.

title: Company Client Status
desc: Indicates whether a responder’s company is a client of IBM or not. A company is considered a client if they have purchased at least25 from IBM in one quarter in the past 4 years.

title: Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of total video starts that result in a video complete (video is watched 75% or more). Calculated: Video Completes / Total Video Starts

title: Content Format
desc: The way the content is delivered to the client to fulfill its purpose, e.g. include PDF, Web Article, and Video. (Content Format is specified in Marketer Workspace)

title: Cost
desc: The total cost of a campaign or project code. This includes net event cost and paid media cost (cash spend). Can be aggregated to Program and Plan level.

title: Cost per Engaged Visit
desc: The cost or campaign investment associated with driving an engaged campaign visit to IBM domain sites. This calculation excludes channels that do not have a cost (ex. owned social and email) from the counts. Calculated: Media Cost (excluding Content Syndication) / Campaign Engaged Visits (incl. only Paid Social, Paid Search, and Display visits).

title: Cost per High Quality Response
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a High Quality Response. Calculated: Total Cost / High Quality Responses

title: Cost per Influence Win
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a Marketing Influence Win. Calculated: Total Cost / Influence Wins

title: Cost per Registration
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a registration. Calculated: Total Cost / Total Registrations

title: Cost per Response
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a Response. Calculated: Total Cost / Total Response Count

title: Cost per RLM Workload
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire RLM workload. Calculated: Total Cost / RLM Workload

title: Cost per Source Validated Lead
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a Source Validated Lead. Calculated: Total Cost / Source Validated Leads

title: Cost per Total Influence Win
desc: The total cost or campaign investment to acquire a Marketing Influence Win. Calculated: Total Cost / Total Influence Wins

title: Country
desc: The geographic location of the person (visitor, client, etc).

title: Cov %
desc: Actual coverage of objectives based on PERFORM value pipeline revenueM.  Percentage value to demonstrate the forecasted revenue based on the projections against the objective set for the Brand/IMT.  Forward-looking pipeline achievement as compared to the pipeline objective.

title: Creation Quarter
desc: The quarter the opportunity detail record was created by a seller in the an opportunity management system (date is system generated).

title: Creation Week
desc: The system datestamp assigned to a lead detail record which indicates the date the record originated in the source system, indicates the week the lead was created.

title: Customer Name
desc: Business name of the IBM customer.

title: Delivery Rate
desc: The percentage of total emails sent that were delivered to the recipient (all emails sent may not result in a delivery due to a Send Failure, Hard Bounce, or Soft Bounce). Calculated: Unique Emails Delivered / Unique Emails Sent

title: Demoters
desc: The count of users who respond negatively to surveys on the likelihood to recommend.

title: Device Type
desc: Segmentation of traffic based on the type of device used by the visitor to browse our pages, e.g. mobile vs desktop.

title: Digital Offerings
desc: A list of digital offerings selected by DBG as their business priority for reporting

title: Direct load
desc: One of the marketing Channel Detail value, which gets a count when the session does not have any referral information.

title: Document Name
desc: The email creative name generated in eMessage.

title: DQ Registrations
desc: Count of total registrations that are considered invalid due to data quality flags (IBMer, Name, Email, Phone, Address)

title: Email Click
desc: Count of the number of times any link (or linked content) within an email was clicked.

title: Email Click Response Rate
desc: The percentage of email clicks (on linked content within the email) that resulted in a response.

title: Email Click Through Rate
desc: The percentage of Emails Delivered that resulted in the recipient clicking on linked content within the email. Calculated: Unique Email Click / Unique Email Delivered

title: Email Only, No Action (Need Investigation)
desc: “Other” in the XXR deep dive tab indicates registrations that were sent to email only and that were not taken actions on.

title: Email Open
desc: Count of email recipients that viewed/opened the email.

title: Email Opt Out
desc: Count of users who have opted out of future email communications from IBM. Count based on email unsubscribe link in footer of all emails. This metric is unavailable currently.

title: Email Response Count
desc: Count of responses generated from email as a channel (identified on the response record through VCPI)

title: Email Sends
desc: Count of emails transmitted by IBMs email server

title: Emails Delivered
desc: Count of unique emails sent minus send failures and soft and hard bounces. The subset of unique emails sent that reached the recipient’s inbox.

title: Engaged Visits
desc: Count of web visits that resulted in a relevant click. This includes clicks to a secondary page (e.g. moving to a product detail page) or engagement on a single page (e.g. videos, downloads, IWM registrations). Engagement does not include clicks on the IBM.com header or footer.

title: Engagement Rate
desc: The percentage of total web visits that can be considered engaged (had a relevant second click). This includes clicks to a secondary page (e.g. moving to a product detail page) and engagement on a single page (e.g. videos, downloads, IWM registrations). Engagement does not include clicks on the IBM.com header or footer. Calculated: Engaged Visits / Total Visits

title: Entry %
desc: The percentage of times a page was the entry page (first page of a visit) for a campaign. Calculated: Total number of entries to page X / Total Entries.

title: Event Brief
desc: Event planning document assigned a unique identifier from Event Workspace (EWS) for a single marketing-led, customer-facing event.  Results reported for all marketing codes specified in the Event Brief.

title: Event Category
desc: A classification of event used to identify who is driving the overall event. Non-Proprietary – When IBM is participating with at least three other companies and a third party: a) controls the audience content date and location b) owns the budget for the overall event and C) creates and hosts the event. Proprietary ‐ IBM is the event producer, contracting with a 3rd party as a sole sponsor, or co-branding an event with another company.

title: Event Date Range
desc: The start and end date of an event as specified in Events Workspace (EWS).

title: Event ID
desc: Unique identifier assigned to an Event Brief

title: Event Objective
desc: The primary goal or objective of your event as specified in Events Workspace (EWS). Lead generating – primarily to generate leads. Lead conversion – primarily to progress or close existing opportunities. Non-lead generating – primarily to bring awareness to attendees but not generate leads.

title: Event Performance
desc: Count of eligible events which are producing opportunities and those that are not producing opportunities. Non-performing:  approved event (review status = approved) that has an event objective of lead generating and have not produced any results (zero Marketing Source, Marketing Progress or Marketing Win Influence) more than 31+ days. Performing:  approved event (review status = approved) that has an event objective of lead generating and has produced results (Marketing Source, Marketing Progress or Marketing Win Influence) more than 31+ days.

title: Executed Event
desc: Event that has occurred, e.g. event start date is today or before

title: Expense vs. VLRC
desc: Calculated percent of Lifetime VLRC that is represented by the Net Event Expense as recorded in the event tool suite.

title: Expense vs. Win Revenue
desc: Calculated percent of Lifetime Win Revenue that is represented by the Net Event Expense in the event tool suite.

title: Flowchart Response Score
desc: Score for the person by business area at the time the flowchart created a workload record to be sent to SalesConnect or Salesforce.

title: Forecast / Decision Quarter
desc: Quarter when the OI / OO is forecasting the opportunity to be signed by the customer (Forecast Date for HW/SW and Decision Date of Services).

title: Forecast / Decision Year
desc: Year when the OI / OO is forecasting the opportunity to be signed by the customer (Forecast Date for HW/SW and Decision Date of Services).

title: Funding Geo
desc: The location of the team that provides the primary funds for a campaign, e.g. a Geo, Market, Country or Worldwide. Determined by the first geography in the Placement field of VCPI, e.g. France_

title: Gap
desc: Revenue gap based on PERFORM RevenueM. Difference between the Projected Pipeline Revenue and the Revenue Objective expressed in dollars.

title: GBT 10
desc: The highest level in IBM’s brand hierarchy which groups products into IBM Business Units defined by Finance, e.g. Security

title: GBT 15
desc: Defines a line of business within an IBM Brand, e.g. Storage

title: GBT 17
desc: Defines a product segment within an IBM Brand, e.g. Mobile Security & Management

title: GBT 20
desc: Defines a primary brand in IBM’s brand hierarchy, e.g. Watson Recruitement

title: GBT 30
desc: Defines a product family in IBM’s brand hierarchy and is identified by a product category code.

title: Geo Level 3
desc: A collection of countries defined by a Geography or Market for reporting purposes to aggregate results from several smaller countries into a single group.

title: Geo Parent
desc: An aggregation of projects in the Plan Framework hierarchy based on the highest Geo project (using project OMT) in the hierarchy plus ALL subsequent projects within Geo below it.

title: Geography
desc: The first level in a three-tiered hierarchy which groups Markets into an operational management unit, e.g. North America, Asia Pacific, etc.

title: GTS Client Value Plays
desc: A sales-led series of tactical activities in order to grow opportunity revenue in a particular solution area or product line involving a variety of customer touch points such as business partners, face to face sales, etc.  Opportunity records can be classified with these sales plays in order to measure their performance.

title: Hard Bounce
desc: Count of email addresses with a permanent bounce (due to errors such as deactivated email account, invalid email address or email addresses that do not exist)

title: High Quality Addressable Responses
desc: Count of responses with a score of Strong or Medium that a campaign is able to contact. Excludes non-addressable responses, e.g. Students, Business Partners, Test Records, Suppressions, etc.

title: High Quality Response Rate
desc: The percentage of Total Responses that are scored as High Quality Responses (Strong or Medium by the response scoring model). Calculated: High Quality Responses / Total Responses.

title: High Quality Responses
desc: Count of Total Responses that were scored by the response scoring model as Strong or Medium.

title: High Value Chat Pts. vs Target
desc: The point difference of high value chats % below target. Calculated: High Value Chat % – IBM Chat Target
synonyms: high value chat points vs target

title: High Value Chat Rate
desc: The percentage of total chats that are considered high value based upon post chat rep survey. Calculated: High Value Chats / Total Chats

title: High Value Chat Rate Target
desc: Chat, rep, and NPS targets set at the beginning of the year set by Marketing Platforms and Digital Sales

title: High Value Chats
desc: Count of chats deemed of high value, based on post chat rep survey. High value chats are determined when there is an interactive chat and the chat result is one of these values: Referred to Online Purchase, Consultant Ed/Progression (Cons E/P), Customer Progression (EMA) Already working with BP or IBM, Out of Region (OOR), Partner Ed/Progression (BP E/P), Download or Free Trial Offer, Offer Accepted (Moved to phone), Opportunity (OPTY) BANT via Chat, Completed General (CPD-Gen), Qualified- New, Qualified- Existing

title: IBMer Registrations
desc: Count of registrations that were identified as IBMers (based on IDM data quality flag that utilizes email address and/or w3 cookie)

title: Impressions
desc: Count of times an IBM advertisement was served or appeared on a web page via paid media (includes paid search, display, and paid social impressions)

title: Indicator
desc: Portion of the Marketing target expected by each week in the year.

title: Individual Newness
desc: Whether a responder is a first-time responder to IBM or not. A responder is considered new if the response is the individual’s first response before or within 30 days of being added to the IBM database (IDM).

title: Industry
desc: The industry that a responder works in. Industry descriptions are based on how the individual self-identied and then organized on the back-end into a standard industry in Marketing Performance Warehouse based on their industry class (SIC code), e.g. Banking or Insurance

title: Initiative
desc: A strategic corporate-led solution area in a specific market where IBM wants to focus.  Opportunity records can be classified with these growth initiatives in order to measure the performance of them.

title: Job Role
desc: The job role a responder holds. Job role descriptions are based on how the individual self-identified and then organized on the back-end into a standard job role in MPW

title: Lead Age
desc: Number of days age grouping for the workload record since creation.

title: Lead Score to XXR
desc: Score displayed to the XXR in the RLM workload record. This is the score the campaign flowchart placed in the record sent to the XXR.

title: Lead Status
desc: Current condition of the records sent to XXRs for action.

title: Lead Status Detail
desc: Provides details showing either progression of the customer contact or additional insight into the reason the record was completed.

title: Lead Update Age
desc: An indication if this opportunity detail record hasn’t been updated since less or more than 45 days.

title: Life of
desc: A metric classification which indicates the metric is not just for the current year, but rather for the cumulative results across all time.

title: Low Quality Addressable Responses
desc: Count of Responses with a score of Weak that a campaign is able to contact. Excludes non-addressable responses, e.g. Students, Business Partners, Test Records, Suppressions, etc.

title: Mailing Name
desc: Name of the mailing within EMM.

title: Market
desc: The second level in a three-tiered geographic hierarchy which groups countries or sectors within a geography into a Market, e.g. DACH, Brazil

title: Market Parent
desc: An aggregation of projects in the Plan Framework hierarchy based on the highest Market project (using project OMT) in the hierarchy plus ALL subsequent projects within Market below it.

title: Marketer Workspace (MWS) Tagging Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of fully tagged assets within the Marketer Workspace Content Inventory. Calculated: Total Tagged Assets / Total Assets

title: Marketing Channel Type
desc: The marketing communication channels that allow IBM to reach potential clients and engage them with IBM content (identified with VCPI tagging and EMM interaction categorization). Some reports are limited to specific Marketing Channel Type Values by design.

title: Marketing Channel Type Category
desc: Segmentation of web traffic sources. The values are either: Campaign (presence of VCPI tags in the session’s referral parameters) or Organic (absence of VCPI tags in the session’s referral parameters).

title: Marketing Comm Channel Name
desc: High-level group of communication channels or interaction methods used to deliver a marketing message.

title: Marketing Comm Channel Type
desc: Detailed communication channel or interaction method used to deliver a marketing message.

title: Marketing Create
desc: A net new opportunity was created by a XXR or a BP comarketing activity

title: Marketing Progress
desc: Opportunity detail records with evidence of progression (sales stage, revenue amount, forecast date improvement)

title: Marketing Source
desc: Client interacted with marketing activities prior to opportunity creation (Marketing Create and Marketing assisted Seller created).

title: Marketing Source Rate % (RLM Only)
desc: Calculated: Count of Source Validated Leads (RLM Only) / RLM Workload

title: Marketing Source Validated Lead Revenue
desc: Revenue value of opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater that meet marketing source criteria for RLM MCR, BP MCR, or Assist to Create. Reported in YTD when opportunity detail create date is in the current year.

title: Marketing Source Validated Leads
desc: Count of opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater that meet marketing source criteria for RLM MCR, BP MCR, or Assist to Create. Reported as YTD when opportunity detail create date is in the current year.

title: Marketing Source Validated Leads (RLM)
desc: Opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater that meet marketing source criteria for RLM MCR

title: Marketing Source Win Revenue
desc: Revenue value of opportunity detail records in a won sales stage that were sourced by Marketing (RLM MCR, BP MCR, or Assist to Create). Included in YTD results when the forecast to bill date (HW/SW) or decision date (Services) is in the current year (regardless of the date / year the opportunity was created).

title: Marketing Source Wins
desc: Count of opportunity detail records in a won sales stage that meet marketing source criteria for RLM MCR, BP MCR, or Assist to Create. Included in YTD when the forecast to bill date (HW/SW) or decision date (Services) is in the current year (regardless of the date / year the opportunity was created).

title: Marketing Win Influence
desc: Count of opportunity detail records in a won sales stage that meet marketing source or marketing progress evidence of progression criteria.

title: Marketing Win Influence Revenue
desc: Revenue value of opportunity detail records in a won sales stage that meet marketing source or marketing progress evidence of progression criteria.

title: Media Cost
desc: Cash Spend on media which excludes credits, over-delivery, agency fees & platform fees (sourced from Datorama) – includes paid search, display, paid social and content syndication

title: Media Responses
desc: Responses driven from paid media channels only (display, paid search, paid social, and content syndication) as determined by VCPI tagging

title: Medium (Top New Contact)
desc: Response score assigned at time of response.

title: Mobile Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of total mobile video starts that result in mobile video completes (video is watched 75% or more). Calculated: Mobile Video Completes / Total Mobile Paid Video Starts

title: Mobile Engagement Rate
desc: The percentage of total mobile visits that are considered engaged (a relevant click / screen touch). Calculated: Mobile Engaged Visits / Total Mobile Visits

title: Multiplier
desc: Number of times the objective is covered by the validated pipeline.

title: No Action Responses
desc: Count of addressable responses where no action was taken by a campaign flowchart. “No Action” includes responses to be investigated and responses where there is no flowchart set up for the campaign.

title: No Show
desc: Count of individuals that registered for an event, but did not physically attend.

title: Non-Addressable Responses
desc: Count of Non-addressable Responses that IBM could not take action on such as Students, IBMer, Business Partner, Not Permitted to Contact, Sent to Sellers, etc.

title: Not Available Visits
desc: Count of visits to pages where the “chat available” tag did not fire. The tag will not fire if there is not an IBM rep logged in and ready to receive a chat. Expected availability is 100% during business hours (8AM-6PM local time). Softlayer pages are excluded.

title: Not in MWS
desc: An indication that either: 1.) The asset is in a live campaign, and is not tagged properly in MWS. Please go to the Content Inventory iGuide in MWS to tag the asset, or 2.) The asset is not in a live campaign. No work to be done, unless added to a live campaign.

title: NPS
desc: A composite score that compares the percentage of users that are promoters to the percentage of users that are detractors based on a survey. Option to take survey can appear to web users during or after specific online interactions, including live chat. Calculated: [(Total Promoters minus Total Detractors) divided by Total Respondents] multiplied by 100 (shown as integer ranging from -100 to 100)

title: Objective (Total Business)
desc: Quarterly revenue objective (Txn for HW/SW, Signings for Services, Annual Signings for XaaS).  Business Objective in dollars which should be achieved at week 15 of the quarter.

title: Offer
desc: Offers identify the marketing message used to present calls-to-action to recipients (broader messaging strategy than a specific asset). An offer is identified by a name and an 8-digit offer code from EMM.

title: Open Rate
desc: The percentage of Emails Delivered that were opened by the recipient. Calculated: Unique Email Opens / Unique Emails Delivered

title: Opportunity Number
desc: Opportunity Number is a unique system-assigned identifier for each opportunity created.

title: Opportunity Owner Org (OO)
desc: The Owning Org within IBM who recommends if IBM should or should not bid on a given opportunity and who represents IBM to the customer for the entire life cycle of the opportunity.

title: Opportunity Source L1
desc: Grouping for Opportunity Source L2 as defined by the Opportunity Source Business Data Standard (BDS),e.g. Marketing, Digital Brand Specialist.

title: Opportunity Source L2
desc: Defines the source of an opportunity as the person or event which “brought an opportunity to IBM ( or to our business partner)”.

title: Opt Out Rate
desc: The percentage of total Emails Delivered that resulted in an Email Opt-out where the user subscribed from future IBM email communications. Calculated: Email Opt-Outs / Unique Emails Delivered

title: Origin
desc: The Marketing Type portion of the VCPI tag which identifies the source or entry-point of a marketing interaction. Will also contain legacy 7.5 terminology that was not mappable to all the new channel values (eg. social media)

title: Originating Marketing Team
desc: IBM Marketing team responsible for the original project/campaign set up in EMM Marketing Operations module. Each project code has an OMT value.

title: Other Web Registrations
desc: Count of the number of times the coremetrics conversion events for Other Registrations were initiated.

title: Owning Event Geo
desc: Identifies the geo (Geo/Market/Country) to which the team who owns the event belongs and is specified in the event tool suite.

title: Page Engaged Visits
desc: Count of engaged visit to a single page. The engaged visit count is not deduplicated here, and thus we cannot add up page engaged visit totals across a group of pages.

title: Page URL
desc: A shortened minimum version of the URL that delivers the same webpage experience.

title: Page Views
desc: The number of times a page was viewed, meaning the page was loaded on the user’s browser.

title: Page Visits
desc: Count of web visits to a single page or URL. Page visits cannot be summed since total visits is calculated at the session level, e.g. one session may have multiple page visits but is counted as one visit and more than one page visit.

title: Paid Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of total paid video starts that result in video completes (video is watched 75% or more). Calculated: Paid Video Completes / Total Paid Video Starts

title: Paid Engagement Rate
desc: Engagement rate calculated at the page level, for one specific Page. The percentage of total paid visits that are considered engaged (session contains a relevant click). Calculated: Paid Engaged Visits / Total Paid Visits

title: Paid Media Engaged Visits
desc: Engaged visit driven from paid media channels only (display, paid search, and paid social) as determined by VCPI tagging

title: Paid Visit
desc: Count of Visits driven by paid channels only (display, paid search, and paid social) as determined by VCPI tagging. Visits are measured and deduplicated at a session level.

title: PERFORM
desc: PERFORM = Pipeline Exploration, Revenue Forecasting, Operational Reporting and Management. Projected calculation of Win Revenue based on Validated+ Pipeline for a given pipeline quarter.

title: Pipeline Age
desc: Group of the opportunity age in days (difference between today and opportunity detail record creation date). Pipeline Age groupings might differ between Business Units.

title: Placement Geo
desc: The location of the persons targeted by a campaign, e.g. UKI, WW, etc. Defined by the second geography in the Placement field of VCPI, e.g. WW_UKI

title: Plan
desc: Plan is the strategic organizing structure for resource allocation, business objectives, reporting, and management systems. It is the highest level in the Plan Framework hierarchy and each Plan will have Programs and Projects aligned to it.

title: Plan Element
desc: Unit of work level for expense and revenue planning. Depicts what will be done to deliver the business objectives, based on pre-defined values.

title: Plan Framework
desc: The strategic organizing structure for executing marketing campaigns that manages resource allocation, business objectives, reporting, and management systems. Campaign hierarchy includes project, program and plan.

title: Platform
desc: A collection of web pages based on their URL string, e.g. Marketplace.

title: PPL Contribution
desc: Percent marketing contribution to PERFORM. PERFORM available for CQ, NQ and NQ+1.

title: Program
desc: Programs logically subdivide a Plan for more effective planning and execution – along profession needs, industry imperatives, or product capablity areas as defined by BU leaders. Each Program will have Projects aligned to it.

title: Project
desc: A unique project or campaign. Distinct projects are identified by an 8-character alphanumeric code (e.g. 00000ABC)

title: Project start date
desc: The date that a campaign/project was launched according to EMM start date.

title: Project status
desc: An indicator in EMM of the stage of the project’s lifecycle, e.g. In Progress or Completed.

title: Proprietary Show Rate
desc: The percent of event registrants who attended the event.  Registrants include those who show up without registering prior to the event. Applies to proprietary events only when IBM took event registrations through GRP or AST.

title: Qualified+
desc: Revenue value of all open or won opportunity detail records in a qualified sales stage or greater.  Includes sales stages of qualified, conditional agreement and won.

title: Qualified+ Contribution
desc: Percent marketing contribution to Qualified+ pipeline.

title: Registered
desc: Count of individuals enrolled in an event.

title: Registration Rate
desc: Percentage of Campaign Visits that resulted in a Registration. Calculated: Campaign registrations / Campaign Visits (both identified by presence of VCPI tagging)

title: Registrations
desc: Count of inbound records where a person has provided business personal information when accepting a call to action and has completed a web registration form, business reply card, event or webcast registration form prior to the event / webcast or interacts with IBM at a third party event.

title: Rep Focus
desc: Lists the IBM rep skills or subject area.

title: Rep IOT
desc: IOT of the IBM DDR Representative.

title: Rep Role
desc: Classifies the IBM rep as a DDR, DOR, Tech, etc… Click on the drop down to see the full list.

title: Response Date
desc: Date that individual responded

title: Response Rate
desc: Percentage of Campaign Visits that resulted in a Response. Calculated: Responses / Campaign Visits (both identified by presence of VCPI)

title: Response Score
desc: The response score assigned by the scoring model (strong, medium, or weak) to the individual responder at the time of form completion.

title: Responses
desc: Count of registrations where the person has provided quality business personal information. Quality business personal business information is when there is a name, one valid contact method (email address, phone, physical address), is from a valid person, is not an IBMer and is unique for the person within a 24 hour period for the campaign, offer and asset.

title: Revenue Type
desc: Categorizes opportunity revenue based upon the offering.  Transactional (FV) is for hardware and software. Total signings (TSV) is for services contracts.  Annual signings (ACV) is for a service offering.

title: RLM Rate
desc: The perecentage of responses sent to XXRs as RLM Workload. Calculated: RLM Workload / Responses.

title: RLM Workload
desc: Number of Leads detail records sent to Response and Lead Management (RLM) resources for interaction.  Includes records where the individual asked to be contacted, the individual responded to a marketing initiative and RLM follow-up is defined by campaign design, or the individual is being targeted for a RLM cold call.

title: Sales Channel
desc: Name of the XXR team to which the records are assigned.

title: Sales Channel Group
desc: Organization to which the XXR Sales Channel belongs.

title: Sales Chat Pts. vs Target
desc: The point difference of sales chat % below target. Calculated: Sales Chat Target % – IBM Target.

title: Sales Chat Rate
desc: The percentage of total chats that were sales related. Calculated: Sales Chats / Total Chats.

title: Sales Chat Rate Target
desc: Chat, rep, and NPS targets set at the beginning of the year set by Marketing Platforms and Digital Sales

title: Sales Chats
desc: Chats deemed sales related, based on post chat rep survey.

title: Sales Opportunity Detail Key
desc: A string of characters which is unique for each opportunity detail record associated with an opportunity number.  Opportunity details define the different products / solutions which belong to the overall opportunity record (e.g. software part, services part, etc.).

title: Sales Stage
desc: Identifies the phase of the sales cycle for an opportunity, e.g. Identified, Validated, etc.

title: Scheduler
desc: Count of the number of times the coremetrics conversion event for the LiveAdvisor Scheduler was initiated.

title: Send Failure
desc: eMessage is able to determine in advance that the email cannot / should not be sent and did not send the email message. Often because the email address has a bad syntax or appears on the global email suppression list.

title: Skillset
desc: Combination of language and skill tagged on the URL. This is used to help route chats to the appropriate IBM rep with the same skillset.

title: Soft Bounce
desc: Count of email addresses with a temporary bounce (due to spam filter, recipient’s mailbox full, email account temporarily suspended, email server outage, etc.)

title: Source Rate % (RLM)
desc: The percentage of RLM Workload that results in Source Validated Leads. Calculated: Count of Source Validated Leads (RLM Only) / RLM Workload.

title: Source Win Conversion (RLM)
desc: The percentage of Source Validated Leads that result in a Source Win. Calculated: Source Wins (RLM Only) / Source Validated Leads (RLM Only)
synonyms: workload % that results in source validated leads

title: Source Wins (RLM)
desc: Opportunity detail records in a won sales stage that meet marketing source criteria for RLM MCR

title: Sponsor Business Unit (BU)
desc: Identifies the the primary IBM Business Unit that an event supports as specified in the event tool suite.

title: Starts per Video
desc: Average starts per video. Calculated: Total Video Starts / Total Distinct Count of Videos

title: Surveys Completed
desc: Number of surveys completed by DDR reps to define the “chat result.” This provides the information we need in order to classify a chat as “Sales” or “High Quality”

title: Tagged Asset
desc: A Campaign Asset within the Marketer Workspace Content Inventory that is tagged with the following fields: Content Type, Content Format, Buyer Stage & Delivery URL.

title: Top Project
desc: A Project that is associated directly to a Program. Using the Top Project filter or dimension will result in aggregate data that includes results for the Top Project and ALL the projects in the hierarchy that fall below it.

title: Total Addressable Responses
desc: Count of Responses that a campaign should taken action on. Excludes non-addressable responses, e.g. Students, Business Partners, Test Records, Suppressions, etc.

title: Traffic Source
desc: An indication of the channel that drove a visit to an IBM domain page. Provides visibility to the different sources that send traffic to IBM.

title: Transaction Size
desc: Categorizes opportunity detail records by revenue value.  Same category groups used for all Business Units.

title: Trials
desc: Count of the number of times the coremetrics conversion event for Trial Sign Up was initiated.

title: Un-Tagged Asset
desc: A Campaign Asset within the Marketer Workspace Content Inventory that has one or more untagged entries for the following fields: Content Type, Content Format, Buying Stage & Delivery URL.

title: Unique Responders
desc: Unique individuals who responded. A response is any web registration or event attendee who has provided personal information. Responses exclude IBMers and invalid records/bad data.

title: Validated Leads Created
desc: Count of opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater. Reported in YTD if opportunity detail create date is in current year.

title: Validated Leads Revenue Created
desc: Revenue value of opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater. Reported in YTD if opportunity detail create date is in current year.

title: Validated Pipeline
desc: Opportunities which are in an open validated or greater sales stage or won and meet the pipeline business criteria.  Pipeline business criteria is identified by Revenue Type (FV, TSV or ACV) indicator = Y.

title: Validated+
desc: Revenue value of all open or won opportunity detail records in a validated sales stage or greater.  Includes sales stages of validated, qualified, conditional agreement and won.

title: Validated+ Contribution
desc: Percent marketing contribution to Validated+ pipeline.

title: Venue Geo
desc: Identifies the geography (Geo/Market/Country) of the physical location of the venue where the event is taking place as specified in the event tool suite.

title: Video Complete
desc: At least 75% of the video has been watched.

title: Video Completion Rate
desc: The percentage of total starts that result in video completes. Calculated: Total Video Completes / Total Video Starts

title: Video Count
desc: The distinct count of videos that have received at lease one start within the filtered date range.

title: Video Length
desc: The length of the video, measured in seconds.

title: Video Starts
desc: When a visitor initiates the start of a video.

title: Visit Rate
desc: The percentage of paid media ad impressions that resulted in a visit. Calculated: Campaign Visits (excluding email and owned social) / Total Impressions
synonyms: % of ad that result in visit

title: Visit/Asset
desc: Average visits per asset. Calculated: Total Visits / Total Distinct Count of Assets

title: Visitor IMT
desc: The Market of the visitor.

title: Visitor IOT
desc: The Geography of the visitor.

title: Win Revenue
desc: Revenue value of opportunities that have a Sales Stage of Won with a forecast to bill date (HW/SW) or decision date (IGS) in the current year (regardless of the date/year the opportunity was created) and meet pipeline business criteria. Pipeline business criteria is identified by Revenue Type (FV, TSV, or ACV) indicator = Y.

title: Wins
desc: Count of opportunity detail records that have a Sales Stage of Won with a forecast to bill date (HW/SW) or decision date (IGS) in the current year (regardless of the date/year the opportunity was created) and meet pipelilne business criteria. Pipeline business criteria is identified by Revenue Type (FV, TSV, or ACV) indicator = Y.

title: Workload Type Category
desc: Indicates the source of the records assigned to RLM resources.

title: WTW
desc: Week to week change. Prior week restated based upon business dimension changes

title: WtW %
desc: Percentage of the year to date actual value represented by the weekly change (WtW) value.

title: YTY
desc: Year to year percentage change from the same point in time last year
